commit_list.message:
Added more UploadError checking to video uploads.

If the response code from the upload to YouTube isn't 201 Created, then the errors are parsed from its return xml.
These errors are then added to the UploadError as message in the following format:
invalid key 1: error_code\r\n
invalid key 2: error_code\r\n

For example, if you leave the description and title empty, you will get:
title: invalid_character\r\n
title: required\r\n
description: invalid_character\r\n
description: required\r\n
as message for the UploadError.

Added an AuthenticationError that will be raised when a HTTP status code 403 is raised during upload.

The message of the AuthenticationError contains the short description in the HTML's title tag that was received from YouTube.

Added support for uploading videos as private media.

You can now specify the :private option with the YouTubeG::Upload::VideoUpload#upload method.
If it is not specified, then the video will remain public.

Bugfix: passing the HTTP response's body to REXML instead of the entire HTTP response.

Fixes the following error:
  RuntimeError: Net::HTTPCreated is not a valid input stream.  It must walk like either a String, an IO, or a Source.

Bugfix: the Upload's http response code is now properly checked.

the http response code is a string, and thus needs to be typecast to an integer if you want to compare it with an 200 integer.

Bugfix: uploadHeader now uses the auth_token method instead of its instance variable.

The auth token wasn't being requested from google, since the method which retrieves it wasn't being called.
The @auth_token instance variable which was passed along in the uploadHeader is set by the auth_token method instead.

commit_list.repo_description: A minimal IRC bot for logging channels

commit_list.message:
Add support for timezone offsets on a per channel basis.

You can now create a file at CHANNEL_LOCATIONS_FILE that contains a
list of channels and (pytz) timezone location names.
All log files for specified channels from that point on will have their
timestamps adjusted to the given timezone.
If a channel is not specified in the config file, it will default to
the timezone specified by DEFAULT_TIMEZONE (which defaults to UTC).

I've started storing this info in a separate config file as I plan to
move all the other settings into a config file as well so people don't
need to edit the script (allowing the script to be re-used more easily).
commit_list.repo_description: A minimal IRC bot for logging channels

commit_list.message:

In some rare cases a logfile with a different capitalisation was still
being created.
commit_list.repo_description: A minimal IRC bot for logging channels

commit_list.message:
Only write quit events on channels that actually had the user in it

Should prevent the quit messages from showing up in all channel logs.
commit_list.repo_description: A minimal IRC bot for logging channels

commit_list.message:
Only write the nick change event on channels that actually have the nick on the channel

This should prevent nick changes appearing in logs that don't have the
user on the channel.

commit_list.message:
Replaced hpricot with nokogiri and everything is now cached with wget.

If a file can not be found in the local cache folder, it will use wget to retrieve the file from the url.
Since everything depends on local files now, open-uri isn't necessary anymore either.
Also, heroes-newerth.com website is now queried only once when files aren't found; not everything you run the parser; should be nicer to them ;-)
To force fetching/caching all items, run ./get_items fetch_all

commit_list.message:
Added more UploadError checking to video uploads.

If the response code from the upload to YouTube isn't 201 Created, then the errors are parsed from its return xml.
These errors are then added to the UploadError as message in the following format:
invalid key 1: error_code\r\n
invalid key 2: error_code\r\n

For example, if you leave the description and title empty, you will get:
title: invalid_character\r\n
title: required\r\n
description: invalid_character\r\n
description: required\r\n
as message for the UploadError.

Added an AuthenticationError that will be raised when a HTTP status code 403 is raised during upload.

The message of the AuthenticationError contains the short description in the HTML's title tag that was received from YouTube.

Added support for uploading videos as private media.

You can now specify the :private option with the YouTubeG::Upload::VideoUpload#upload method.
If it is not specified, then the video will remain public.

Bugfix: passing the HTTP response's body to REXML instead of the entire HTTP response.

Fixes the following error:
  RuntimeError: Net::HTTPCreated is not a valid input stream.  It must walk like either a String, an IO, or a Source.

Bugfix: the Upload's http response code is now properly checked.

the http response code is a string, and thus needs to be typecast to an integer if you want to compare it with an 200 integer.

Bugfix: uploadHeader now uses the auth_token method instead of its instance variable.

The auth token wasn't being requested from google, since the method which retrieves it wasn't being called.
The @auth_token instance variable which was passed along in the uploadHeader is set by the auth_token method instead.

Ensure whitespaces are stripped when merging string joins. [#1297 state:resolved]

Signed-off-by: Pratik Naik <pratiknaik@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
A work-in-progress ImageMagick script to convert a bunch of images into an animation.

Currently allows you to:
- create intermediate copies for further processing,
- trim frames by selecting every nth frame,
- specify delays,
- set animation dimensions,
- skip existing files,
- specify a frame range
- create a back-to-front animation which reverses at the end of the animation
- skip the normal animation
- specify a base path

Added a simple, menu-oriented, CLI tool to check for some (possible) #heartbleed affected clients.

Currently allows you to:

* check the openssl version against which your current ruby is built;
* get a list of open files that match an openssl that's different from 1.0.1g
* install/upgrade openssl through homebrew on OSX
* re-install Ruby via rbenv

commit_list.message:
Added more UploadError checking to video uploads.

If the response code from the upload to YouTube isn't 201 Created, then the errors are parsed from its return xml.
These errors are then added to the UploadError as message in the following format:
invalid key 1: error_code\r\n
invalid key 2: error_code\r\n

For example, if you leave the description and title empty, you will get:
title: invalid_character\r\n
title: required\r\n
description: invalid_character\r\n
description: required\r\n
as message for the UploadError.

Added an AuthenticationError that will be raised when a HTTP status code 403 is raised during upload.

The message of the AuthenticationError contains the short description in the HTML's title tag that was received from YouTube.

Added support for uploading videos as private media.

You can now specify the :private option with the YouTubeG::Upload::VideoUpload#upload method.
If it is not specified, then the video will remain public.

Bugfix: passing the HTTP response's body to REXML instead of the entire HTTP response.

Fixes the following error:
  RuntimeError: Net::HTTPCreated is not a valid input stream.  It must walk like either a String, an IO, or a Source.

Bugfix: the Upload's http response code is now properly checked.

the http response code is a string, and thus needs to be typecast to an integer if you want to compare it with an 200 integer.

Bugfix: uploadHeader now uses the auth_token method instead of its instance variable.

The auth token wasn't being requested from google, since the method which retrieves it wasn't being called.
The @auth_token instance variable which was passed along in the uploadHeader is set by the auth_token method instead.

Added FuzZyBookmarks

Set of scripts and functions to jump between bookmarked directories using fzf (fuzzyfinder), as well as easily add and delete them.
Based on idea and code by Dmitry Frank at https://dmitryfrank.com/articles/shell_shortcuts, as well as comment by 'jochen'.

commit_list.message:
Add support for timezone offsets on a per channel basis.

You can now create a file at CHANNEL_LOCATIONS_FILE that contains a
list of channels and (pytz) timezone location names.
All log files for specified channels from that point on will have their
timestamps adjusted to the given timezone.
If a channel is not specified in the config file, it will default to
the timezone specified by DEFAULT_TIMEZONE (which defaults to UTC).

I've started storing this info in a separate config file as I plan to
move all the other settings into a config file as well so people don't
need to edit the script (allowing the script to be re-used more easily).

commit_list.message:
Fixes issue with scheduling a golem/fallen/portal event that hasn't been scheduled before.

Now you can !set portal|fallen|golem even if it hasn't been scheduled before. This used to generate an error because it could not find the event in the scheduled events list.
This also fixes the issue where the specified alliance wasn't being used when returning the newly scheduled event. (!set $alliance_tag $event would return the event for the main alliance instead of $alliance_tag)

commit_list.message:
Updated 'nice names' for the various profiles, added 64-bit Debugger profile support, improved univ build support

At some point PPC support was dropped in openMSX for universal builds.
However, openMSX-Builder does still offer universal builds that include
PPC due to an override.

The openMSX Debugger can now also be build for the x86_64 platform and
support for that is also added in this commit. You will need to add
:target_cpu to your Debugger profile in your ~/.openMSX-builder.yaml
config though. See this commit's diff for example profiles.

The 'nice names' for the profiles have also been updated to more
clearly show for which platform the builds are.

Mac OS X 10.6 Snow Leopard also changed the 'hdiutil: create failed
error 49168' error message that randomly  occurs, and support for this
was added as well.

commit_list.message:
More versatile command line support for selecting which profiles to be build.

You can now specify --profiles on the command line to show which
(default) profiles are available.
You can also specify --profiles profile1,profile2,profileN to specify a
list of profiles to be built.
By default it will build all default profiles (:openmsx_x86_64,
:openmsx_x86, :openmsx_ppc, :openmsx_univ, :openmsx_debugger,
:openmsx_debugger_x86_64).

If you just want to build the univ profile and the both debuggers, you
could specify:
--profiles openmsx_univ,openmsx_debugger,openmsx_debugger_x86_64

commit_list.message:
Initial commit of working codebase for openMSX-Builder.

openMSX-Builder is used for building the latest SVN checkouts of openMSX and openMSX-Debugger from http://openmsx.sf.net.
It also supports publishing the created builds to an external location via scp, in my case that is http://openmsx.fixato.net.
Successfully published builds can also be announced via Twitter. Setting up the oauth info has to be done manually still, for more information on that read http://github.com/moomerman/twitter_oauth#, http://twitter.com/oauth and http://apiwiki.twitter.com/Authentication

commit_list.message:
[battlearena.py] 0.4: includes some bugfixes

Overview of changes since 0.3:
- Red and Black Orbs are now tracked in:
  * !orbs response
  * 'Boss defeated' messages
  * 'End of battle' messages
  * 'Unlocked treasure chest' messages
- Bunch of bar items added:
  * battlearena_orbs
  * battlearena_current_weapon
  * battlearena_battle_mode
  * battlearena_player_turn
  * battlearena_health_status
  * battlearena_status_effects
  * battlearena_active_skills
- Added 'Tracking' AutoBattle mode
- Renamed default AutoBattle mode to 'AutoAttack'
- Improved stealing and taunting logic.
- Added support for curse and melee-only
- Taking various status effects into account at your turn
- DEBUG log() support added.

commit_list.message:
[battlearena.py] Added checks for cursed and various turn-skipping status effects.

If intimidated, paralyzed, frozen in time, bored or stunned is in the status effects, the attack turn should be skipped.
If you are cursed, or if it is a melee-only battle, then only taunting, stealing or regular attacks should be performed.

commit_list.message:
Improved weapon choice possibilities for the autobattle system.

- If you run out of TP, Tech attacks are temporarily disabled.
- More fine-tuned tech selection criteria. You can now specify for which weapon you want to pick techs, and whether it should be a random tech, the one with the highest, or the one with the lowest level.
- Auto-switching to the appropriate weapon based on a tech. Note: you need to have !equip'ed and done !techs for that/those weapon(s) at least once since loading the script.

TODO: store a list of your weapons and techs in a more permanent database so we don't need to issue !techs all the time...

commit_list.message:
[clone_scanner] Bugfix: on-join scanner works again. Scans on hosts are now case insensitive.

I was using an old variable for the clones.
Also, in case a network uses vhosts, hostnames are now forced to lowercase when matching.
To make sure the joining user is also listed in the infolist, hooking on irc_in2_join instead of irc_in_join.

commit_list.message:
Initial commit of clone_scanner.py and my weechat_scripts repo.

My personal repository of scripts for the WeeChat chat client,
www.weechat.org Scripts I've written to add features to WeeChat I felt
were missing.  clone_scanner.py is a script to detect if a joining user
is already on the channel from a different nick with the same hostname.
commit_list.repo_description: My personal repository of scripts for the WeeChat chat client, www.weechat.org. Scripts I've written to add features to WeeChat I felt were missing.

commit_list.message: listbuffer.py 0.7.1: fix undefined global variable
urlserver.py 0.8: add options http_fg_color/http_css_url/http_title, add descriptive classes to html elements
autojoin.py 0.2.4: use name of channel instead of buffer short_name, add support for key-protected channels
clone_scanner.py 1.0: fix on-join scanner bug (introduced in version 0.9)
clone_scanner.py 0.7: do not pop up on script loading, add option "autofocus"
urlserver.py 0.9: add options "http_autostart" and "http_port_display", "url_min_length" can now be set to -1 to auto-detect minimal URL length, auto hide port 80 in shortened URL
clone_scanner.py 1.1: use lower case comparison in the on-join scan
clone_scanner.py 0.9: add option "compare_idents"
weestats.py 0.2: add window split info, add missing call to infolist_free()
New script weestats.py: insert some statistics about buffers/windows on command line
clone_scanner.py 0.8: fix bug with autofocus (do not always force the buffer to be focused)
listbuffer.py 0.7: many changes
